item.title: Chef d’équipe –expert institutionnel
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Assistance technique long terme au profit du Ministère de l’Intérieur au Niger

La présente mission d'assistance technique s'inscrit dans le cadre de l'exécution du Contrat relatif à la Construction de l’Appareil de L’Etat (SBC II) du 11e FED et se déroulera sur une période totale de 24 mois avec des experts résidents et des expertises de courte durée pour des missions spécifiques. Elle a pour objet de renforcer le pilotage et la gouvernance du ministère en charge de l'intérieur.

Le prestataire devra appuyer le gouvernement, notamment le ministère de l'intérieur dans l'amélioration du pilotage et la gouvernance de la sécurité intérieure.

Cette mission, consistera à la mise en place d’une assistance technique long terme, placée au Ministère de l'Intérieur. Cette assistance technique comprendra deux experts long terme résidents (dont un Chef d’Equipe et un expert pour la migration) et des expertises perlées.

Expert principal 1 (CAT 1): Chef d’équipe – expert institutionnel

Le chef de mission, doit avoir le profil minimum suivant :

  • Qualifications et compétences : Diplômes universitaires/études supérieurs (Bac +5) en management/gestion, administration publique, économie, statistiques, droit, sécurité ou tout autre diplôme équivalent
  • Expérience professionnelle générale : au moins douze (12) années d’expérience

Expérience professionnelle spécifique :

  • au moins dix ans d'expérience en matière de pilotage et gouvernance sectoriels dans une administration donnée ;
  • gestion des finances publiques ;
  • connaissance approfondie des directives de L'UEMOA relatives à la gestion des finances publiques (DPPD/budget programmes sectoriels, PAP, RAP, …) ;
  • connaissance et expériences avérées en développement institutionnel ;
  • Une connaissance pratique et/ou expérience du management et de la gestion des ressources humaines ;
  • avoir réalisé au moins une mission d'assistance technique de longue durée dans les pays de l'UEMOA et/ou de la CMAC ;
  • connaissance approfondie dans la planification stratégique et opérationnelle, le suivi évaluation et la gestion axée sur les résultats ;
  • Excellentes connaissance des procédures de passation de marché de l'UE.

L’expérience spécifique dans les secteurs concernés sera considérée comme un atout

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Child Protection Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Review of Sector Reform Contract ‘Support to Human Rights Protection in Armenia’

The general objective of the Sector Reform Contract is to support the protection of human rights in Armenia.

Specific objectives of the Programme:

(l) Improving the protection of human rights through enacting and implementing relevant legislation in the areas of right to free elections, torture prevention, anti-discrimination (including minorities, people with disabilities, refugees and other vulnerable groups), gender equality and child protection. (2) Enhancing coordination and cooperation in the area of human rights and increasing capacity of relevant stakeholders

The current Terms of Reference is for reviews planned for 2017 and 2018 in order to assess the progress in the conditions attached to the release of two variable tranches of budget support. The specific objective of the assignment is to provide 2 reports containing recommendations as a tool for decision on disbursement of variable tranches and overall programme execution. The conclusions of the reviews will be used to decide upon the disbursement of the two variable instalments foreseen in 2017 and 2018.

Child Protection Expert

  • MA degree or equivalent academic qualifications in the field of social sciences, political science, public administration, economics or relevant field
  • At least 6 years of practical experience (as defined below) Good knowledge of English
  • Knowledge of Armenian will be considered an advantage

Professional Experience

  • Proven experience in the field of social service delivery, in particular in the field of child protection and deinstitutionalisation of children
  • Specific knowledge of Armenian system of child protection and referral
  • Strong analytical skills and demonstrated capacity to perform researches and evaluations
  • Proven experience in transition countries and CIS will be considered an asset

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert no 2: Trade in Services Expert, Category II
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Assessment of the competitiveness of services in Lebanon and impact of World Trade Organisation (WTO) accession

The overall objective of the assignment is to assess the potential of the Lebanese services sector in order to foster economic growth by enhancing the country’s competitiveness in selected sectors considered strategic for the country.

In looking at Lebanon’s potential in the services sector, there is a need to assess the possible benefits of further liberalisation, including within the perspective of WTO accession. Policy recommendations are expected at the end of the study targeted at removing restrictions for the development of the service sector.

Expert no 2: Trade in Services Expert, Category II

Education and Skills:

  • University Master’s degree in any of the following disciplines: international trade, political studies, law or international relations. In absence of Master’s Degree, additional 3 years of professional experience in addition to the required below could be considered as equivalent
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Able to work in close cooperation with all international and local stakeholders.

Experience:

  • At least 5 years of experience in international trade, in particular trade in services (design of programmes/projects on trade; evaluation of trade policies and/or domestic reforms of a country).
  • Very good knowledge of trade technical issues/trade related areas and WTO issues
  • Sectoral expertise in trade in services in a least one of the following sectors: knowledge economy/ICT; insurance; legal services; transport.
  • Previous work experience(s) in MENA countries, in particular Lebanon.

Language Skills

  • Excellent command of English.
  • Arabic is compulsory.
  • French would be considered as an asset.
  • Excellent writing and editing skills.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: 4 Experts, Evaluation a mi-parcours NFD 'Une administration pour tous'
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation a mi-parcours NFD ‘Une administration pour tous’

  • une appréciation globale, en toute indépendance, des résultats de l’intervention de NFD en s’attachant plus particulièrement aux résultats du projet par rapport à ses objectifs;
  • les principaux enseignements de l'intervention et des recommandations afin d’améliorer les mesures en cours et les futures actions et choix stratégiques futurs, aussi en vue d’une possible demande d’avenant pour le projet.

Les principaux utilisateurs de cette évaluation seront la Délégation de l’Union européenne auprès de la République du Madagascar, le Gouvernement de Madagascar dont le PREA (Programme de Renforcement de l'Efficacité de l'Administration) en particulier, le contractant et l’équipe d’assistance technique du projet NFD. L’évaluation présentera également un intérêt pour les partenaires techniques et financiers et pour la société civile au sens large.

L'équipe d'évaluation sera composée au moins de 3 experts categorie I au II et 1 expert de categorie I (4 experts au total) comme contrôle de qualité possédant le profil et les qualifications suivants en tant qu’equipe:

Compétences communes:

  • une expérience solide et diversifiée dans le domaine d'expertise spécifique requis, notamment une expérience en matière d'évaluation de projets et des evaluation des reformes institutionnelles (pour au moins deux experts, dont le chef d'équipe);
  • une expérience de la région (le nombre d'années d'expérience peut être différent d'un expert à un autre, indépendamment de son statut dans l'équipe); la connaissance du Madagascar sera un plus, notamment pour le chef d’equipe
  • la maîtrise opérationnelle du français ainsi qu'une excellente capacité en matière de rédaction de rapports;
  • la maîtrise totale des principes et des méthodes de travail de la gestion du cycle de projet ainsi que des méthodes de l'aide communautaire;

Compétences particulières:

  • Au moins un expert proposé doit posséder à la fois une connaissance solide en Finance Publique et de l'analyse de la prise en compte de ces questions dans le processus de reforme
  • Au moins un expert proposé doit posséder à la fois une connaissance solide dans le secteur de gestion des Ressouces Humaines de l’Etat en particulier dans le processus de reforme
  • Au moins un expert proposé doit posséder une connaissance en matière de reformes du secteur de la Justice
  • Au moins un expert doit disposer d'une expérience pratique des techniques d’analyse de PEA (Political Economy Analysis)

La composition de l'équipe d'experts doit être équilibrée afin de permettre une couverture exhaustive des différents aspects de l'évaluation de projets (thematiques et méthodes et techniques d'évaluation) exposés dans les présents termes de référence, notamment des questions transversales.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert in Investment Promotion and Reforms & Financial Services to SMEs
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation of Programme to Support the Investment and the Business Environment in the SADC Region

Global objective

The global objective of the assignment is to provide expert assistance to the SADC Secretariat and the EU Delegation to Botswana and SADC in order to complete the formulation of a Programme on “Support to the Investment and the Business Environment in the SADC Region”, taking into account the assistance provided to by other International Cooperation Partners (ICPs). The Programme is foreseen to be funded by the 11th EDF under the Annual Action programme 2017.

Specific objectives

The specific objective is to finalise Action Fiche for this programme, to be financed from EDF 11 and to be presented to EU Headquarters within the Annual Action Plan (AAP) 2017. In this regard, the Formulation Mission will complete the programme design, in particular regarding the following aspects:

  • Revise the current Action Document and foreseen activities;
  • Advise on the most adequate implementation modality for each component;
  • Identify the most appropriate implementing partners for each of the components, citing reasons for the proposed implementation partners;
  • Finalise the full formulation of the programme in line with EU project Cycle Guidelines, and assist in the production of all formulation documents needed to be included in the Annual Action Programme (AAP) 2017 in line with the latest templates and in consultation with the SADC Secretariat and stakeholders, the EU Delegation and other ICPs;

Expert in Investment Promotion and Reforms & Financial Services to SMEs

  • Preferably Masters degree in Finance, Economics or equivalent or, in its absence, at least 3 years of professional experience in addition to the minimum professional experience required;
  • At least 6 years of professional experience on investment promotion and reforms to improve the business environment; • Fluency in English (written, spoken, understanding); • Expertise and experience in analytical and presentation skills. • Experience on financial services to Small, medium and micro-enterprises (credit lines, equity, guarantees, micro-credit); • Good understanding of EDF rules and procedures; • Experience on EU project formulation; • Experience in a Sub-Saharan African context. Specific experience in the SADC region will be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert in Business Association Development (Cat.III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Revision of the Industrial Policy 2009-2020 ** The **overall objective of the project is to strengthen the strategic framework and the institutional capacity for industry development in Macedonia.

The *specific objectives *of this assignment are:

1) to assist Ministry of Economy to revise the Industrial policy 2009-2016; 2) to set up Industrial policy M&E mechanism; 3) to upgrade the web portal www.konkurentnost.mk; and 4) to strengthen the cluster policy and operation of clusters.

Project duration: 365 days

*Expert in Business Association Development (Cat.III) *

*Education *

  • At least master’s degree in the area of economics or public administration, or, in its absence, general professional experience of at least 3 years above the below required general professional experience

General professional experience:

  • At least 3 years' experience in providing advice/consulting to governments in the area of development of business support services.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 1 year experience as capacity building advisor or manager of business associations (such as: chamber, cluster, hub, incubator, etc);

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

item.title: Senior PPP Expert (Cat.I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Advice for Structuring a Public-Private Partnership Transaction for the Zarqa IWWTP

The objective of this Assignment is to support the government in the preparation of the Project Zarqa IWWTP which has as overall goal to develop a cost-effective treatment and disposal alternative that meets the needs of the industries and the MoE as well as to provide opportunities for improved resources management via effluent and sludge reuse.

On a regional scale, the project will support the integrated water resources management and wastewater pollution abatement in the industrial sector.

Senior PPP Expert (Cat.I)

minimum of 40 working days for phase A

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master’s Degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration, Engineering, Science, Arts or equivalent.

General professional experience:

  • At least 15 years of experience in working on designing, preparing or implementing PPP schemes of which preferably a minimum of 5 years spent on international projects (outside usual country of professional practice);

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 5 years of experience as PPP expert in water and/or wastewater infrastructure projects.
  • Experience in working with Government officials or another public administration advisory role in his/her capacity as PPP expert is an asset.
  • Experience in the country and in the region would be an asset.

Language Skills:

  • Fluent in oral and written English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to eiblot5@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

The objective of this Assignment is to support the government in the preparation of the Project Zarqa IWWTP which has as overall goal to develop a cost-effective treatment and disposal alternative that meets the needs of the industries and the MoE as well as to provide opportunities for improved resources management via effluent and sludge reuse.

On a regional scale, the project will support the integrated water resources management and wastewater pollution abatement in the industrial sector.

minimum of 40 working days for phase A

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 2 years of experience in the financial analysis for PPP projects.
  • Preferably have worked on at least 3 Feasibility Studies determining NPV, FIRR, EIRR of investment costs and setting tariffs in the water / wastewater sector.
  • Experience in project-based financial modelling, financial due diligence, Cost Benefit Analysis, and/or impact & monitoring analysis would be an asset
  • Experience with IFIs, including EIB or European Commission, would be an asset.
  • Experience in working with Government officials or another public administration advisory role in his/her capacity as economist is an asset.

item.title: Key Expert 2–Technical Advisor – Wastewater (Cat. II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Advice for Structuring a Public-Private Partnership Transaction for the Zarqa IWWTP

The objective of this Assignment is to support the government in the preparation of the Project Zarqa IWWTP which has as overall goal to develop a cost-effective treatment and disposal alternative that meets the needs of the industries and the MoE as well as to provide opportunities for improved resources management via effluent and sludge reuse.

On a regional scale, the project will support the integrated water resources management and wastewater pollution abatement in the industrial sector.

Key Expert 2–Technical Advisor – Wastewater (Cat. II)

minimum of 50 working days for phase A and 30 for phase B (optional)

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Sanitary Engineering, or Environmental Engineering or academic equivalent.

General professional experience:

  • At least 10 years of experience in wastewater projects of which preferably 5 years spent on international projects (outside usual country of professional practice).

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 2 Feasibility Studies for WWTPs as wastewater treatment specialist / process engineer in the last 10 years that include both wastewater and sludge treatment.
  • Preferably have worked on at least 2 projects in industrial wastewater treatment;
  • Experience in the country or in the region would be an asset.

Language Skills:

  • Fluent in oral and written English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to eiblot5@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Environment Expert – Wastewater Sector (TL) (Cat.I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Advice for Structuring a Public-Private Partnership Transaction for the Zarqa IWWTP

The objective of this Assignment is to support the government in the preparation of the Project Zarqa IWWTP which has as overall goal to develop a cost-effective treatment and disposal alternative that meets the needs of the industries and the MoE as well as to provide opportunities for improved resources management via effluent and sludge reuse.

On a regional scale, the project will support the integrated water resources management and wastewater pollution abatement in the industrial sector.

Senior Environment Expert – Wastewater Sector (TL) (Cat.I)

minimum of 160 working days for phase A and 10 for phase B (optional)

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Sanitary Engineering, Environmental Engineering or a related field, or academic equivalent.

General professional experience:

  • At least 15 years of experience in environmental projects;
  • Preferably years spent on international projects (outside usual country of professional practice).

Specific professional experience:

  • Preferably have 5 years of experience as team leader;
  • Preferably have 6 years of experience in the wastewater sector;
  • Preferably have worked on 2 Feasibility Studies for similar projects as Project Manager in the last 10 years.
  • Preferably have worked on 2 Projects that were tendered through a DB(O) and/or a BOT model during the tender phase in the last 10 years.
  • Experience in the region is required.
  • Experience with IFIs, including EIB or European Commission, would be an asset.

Language Skills:

  • Fluent in oral and written English
  • Knowledge of Arabic would be an asset

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to eiblot5@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Experto/a 2 (Categoría II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mapeo Y Analisis Estrategico De La Capacidad Tecnica De Nicaragua En Evaluacion De La Confirmidad

El objetivo general del estudio es proporcionar información al Gobierno de Nicaragua sobre las necesidades de mejora de la infraestructura de calidad para aumentar el acceso de productos y subproductos de origen animal, vegetal, apícola, acuícola, pesquero, nicaragüenses priorizados a los mercados internacionales y consumo interno; a través del reforzamiento de la capacidad sistémica del país en materia de la evaluación de la conformidad (EC).

El objetivo específico del estudio es realizar un diagnóstico de la infraestructura de la calidad, con especial énfasis en el pilar de la EC, que incluye un mapeo de la oferta de servicios, usuarios y financiadores, la evaluación de la capacidad del SNC para responder a los requisitos de inocuidad, seguridad y calidad establecidos por los mercados de exportación y de consumo interno, así como la pertinencia del marco jurídico actual.

El estudio debe evaluar las capacidades de EC (ensayos, certificación y acreditación, principalmente) disponibles en el país, tanto en el sector público como en el sector privado.

Para ello debe partir de la caracterización de la demanda de servicios de control y aseguramiento de la calidad por parte del sector productivo, como núcleo de diagnóstico,análisis y evaluación, con respecto a las MSF y requisitos de calidad establecidos por los principales mercados de exportación. También se deberán considerar las necesidades y requisitos establecidos por las autoridades sanitarias y fitosanitarias de Nicaragua para prevenir y combatir plagas y enfermedades. De igual manera, debe sistematizar los avances alcanzados, tanto en inversiones, como en propuestas de políticas y planificación, así como las limitantes que estos procesos han encontrado.

El estudio deberá facilitar una visión global de las fortalezas y debilidades del país en materia de EC bajo una perspectiva sistémica, que incluya el marco normativo y functional del SNC en los diversos pilares que interactúan con la EC: normalización, reglamentación, metrología, acreditación y certificación, entre otros, de modo que ayude al Gobierno de Nicaragua definir las necesidades de reforzamiento de la capacidad del país en materia de EC para mejorar el acceso de productos nicaragüenses priorizados a los mercados internacionales. El informe incluirá también una propuesta de líneas estratégicas de actuación y las prioridades de inversión para el reforzamiento de la infraestructura de calidad, con énfasis en la EC.

Experto/a 2 (categoría II)

Formación y cualificación

  • Titulación universitaria en Química o Bioquímica, o formaciones afines vinculadas con los laboratorios de Sanidad Animal y Vegetal.
  • Perfecto dominio del idioma español, lengua de trabajo durante la misión, y dominio también del idioma inglés.

Experiencia

  • Mínima de 8 años en la gestión o realización de ensayos en laboratorios de Sanidad Animal y/o Vegetal. Se valorará favorablemente experiencia en laboratorios oficiales.
  • Mínima de 3 años en procesos de acreditación de ensayos.
  • Buen conocimiento y experiencia mínima de 2 años en la región Centroamericana. Se valorará favorablemente experiencia en Nicaragua.
  • Experiencia en la redacción y edición de documentos metodológicos y operativos.
  • Experiencia en trabajo en equipo.
  • Capacidad de relación para la realización de entrevistas y capacidad de organización y análisis de datos e información.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Experto/A 1, Jefe/A De Misión (Categoría I):
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mapeo y analisis estrategico de la capacidad tecnica de Nicaragua en evaluacion de la confirmidad

El objetivo general del estudio es proporcionar información al Gobierno de Nicaragua sobre las necesidades de mejora de la infraestructura de calidad para aumentar el acceso de productos y subproductos de origen animal, vegetal, apícola, acuícola, pesquero, nicaragüenses priorizados a los mercados internacionales y consumo interno; a través del reforzamiento de la capacidad sistémica del país en materia de la evaluación de la conformidad (EC).

El objetivo específico del estudio es realizar un diagnóstico de la infraestructura de la calidad, con especial énfasis en el pilar de la EC, que incluye un mapeo de la oferta de servicios, usuarios y financiadores, la evaluación de la capacidad del SNC para responder a los requisitos de inocuidad, seguridad y calidad establecidos por los mercados de exportación y de consumo interno, así como la pertinencia del marco jurídico actual.

El estudio debe evaluar las capacidades de EC (ensayos, certificación y acreditación, principalmente) disponibles en el país, tanto en el sector público como en el sector privado.

Para ello debe partir de la caracterización de la demanda de servicios de control y aseguramiento de la calidad por parte del sector productivo, como núcleo de diagnóstico,análisis y evaluación, con respecto a las MSF y requisitos de calidad establecidos por los principales mercados de exportación. También se deberán considerar las necesidades y requisitos establecidos por las autoridades sanitarias y fitosanitarias de Nicaragua para prevenir y combatir plagas y enfermedades. De igual manera, debe sistematizar los avances alcanzados, tanto en inversiones, como en propuestas de políticas y planificación, así como las limitantes que estos procesos han encontrado.

El estudio deberá facilitar una visión global de las fortalezas y debilidades del país en materia de EC bajo una perspectiva sistémica, que incluya el marco normativo y functional del SNC en los diversos pilares que interactúan con la EC: normalización, reglamentación, metrología, acreditación y certificación, entre otros, de modo que ayude al Gobierno de Nicaragua definir las necesidades de reforzamiento de la capacidad del país en materia de EC para mejorar el acceso de productos nicaragüenses priorizados a los mercados internacionales. El informe incluirá también una propuesta de líneas estratégicas de actuación y las prioridades de inversión para el reforzamiento de la infraestructura de calidad, con énfasis en la EC.

Experto/A 1, Jefe/A De Misión (Categoría I)

Formación y cualificación

  • Titulación universitaria en Ciencias Económicas, Sociales o Políticas, Veterinaria,Ingeniería Agrónoma u otra carrera afín a las tareas solicitadas.
  • Perfecto dominio del idioma español, lengua de trabajo durante la misión, y dominio también del idioma inglés.

Experiencia

  • Mínima de 12 años en temas relacionados con el comercio internacional, que incluya excelente conocimiento de la normativa aplicable por los principales mercados importadores, especialmente en materia de MSF y Calidad, y relevantes conocimientos de infraestructura de la calidad.
  • Mínima de 5 años en temas relacionados con desarrollo agroindustrial.
  • Mínima de 5 años en proyectos de cooperación, que incluya procesos de identificación y diagnóstico, formulación, auditoría y/o evaluación.
  • Buen conocimiento y experiencia mínima de 3 años en cooperación en la region Centroamericana. Se valorará favorablemente experiencia en Nicaragua.
  • Experiencia en la redacción y edición de documentos metodológicos y operativos en el ámbito de cooperación.
  • Experiencia en liderazgo de pequeños equipos de expertos.
  • Capacidad de relación para la realización de entrevistas y capacidad de organización y análisis de datos e información. Como jefe de la misión sus responsabilidades supondrán la coordinación del proceso para la realización del estudio y elaboración del informe final.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
